item.title: [ALLSTAR] Still not fixed, can i get help fixing it? [ALLSTAR]
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

Its not solved yet this is the recent code i got from your helping.
How Eclipse going to help me this? i usually use eclipse for brackets problems ({, })

Do you want the run.bat error?
[client-1-f2]: playerCommand: setRight
java.lang.NullPointerException
at client.customCommand(client.java:10108)
at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:20221)
at client.packetProcess(client.java:15783)
at client.packetSending(client.java:15752)
at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:138)
at server.main(server.java:48)
Game saved for player f2
ClientHandler Client f2 disconnected.

EDIT: Iv’e runned the classes general and client with eclipse and i got no errors but still the same errors on the run.bat what to do?

item.title: [ALLSTAR] Still not fixed, can i get help fixing it? [ALLSTAR]
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

[ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR][ALLSTAR]
For The full code go to-

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


When ever i use something from the General class i made its giving me an errors (in the run.bat).

public class General {
    client c;
public General(client c) {
this.c = c;
}
    public void setRights(int rights) {
        c.playerRights = rights;
        c.sendMessage("You have changed your rights to"+rights);
    }

}

Then i use it in the client.java like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("setRight")) {
g.setRights(3);
}

When ever i use something from the General class i made its giving me an errors (in the run.bat).
